data.title: Film and TV History in 1968
data.meta_description: Events in film & television in 1968. Browse important and interesting events in film and TV in 1968 or search by date or keyword.
data.text:
ABC radio splits into 4 networks (Info, Entertainment, Contemp & FM)

Jan 1 Netherlands gets color TV

Jan 1 WDCO TV channel 15 in Cochran, GA (PBS) begins broadcasting

KBHK TV channel 44 in San Francisco, California (IND) begins broadcasting

Leo Fender sells Fender Guitars for $13 million to CBS

"GE College Bowl" quiz show premieres on NBC TV

Nighttime version of "Hollywood Squares" premieres on NBC TV

KDCD TV channel 18 in Midland, Texas (IND) begins broadcasting

Film & TV History

Al Pacino stars in "The Indian Wants the Bronx" at the Astor Place Theatre, winning an Obie Award for Best Actor

Music Premiere

John Kander and Fred Ebb's musical "The Happy Time", starring Robert Goulet, opens at Broadway Theater, NYC; runs for 286 performances

WKBF TV channel 61 in Cleveland, Ohio (IND) begins broadcasting

"Bonnie and Clyde"

Arthur Penn's film "Bonnie and Clyde" premieres in Paris, France with stars Warren Beatty & Faye Dunaway in attendance

"Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In" premieres on NBC

KDTV TV channel 39 in Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas (IND) begins broadcasting

KESD TV channel 8 in Brookings, SD (PBS) begins broadcasting

WLED TV channel 49 in Littleton, NH (PBS) begins broadcasting

Film "Planet of the Apes", based on Pierre Boulle's 1963 novel "La Planète des singes" premieres in New York City

Golden Globes

25th Golden Globes: "In the Heat of the Night", Rod Steiger, & Edith Evans win

WHKY TV channel 14 in Hickory, NC (IND) begins broadcasting

WVUT TV channel 22 in Vincennes, Indiana (PBS) begins broadcasting

Children's educational TV program "Mister Rogers' Neighborhood" debuts on NET (now PBS)

Silent Sun

Rock group Genesis release their 1st record "Silent Sun"

Vietnam War

CBS news anchor Walter Cronkite delivers a scathing editorial on America's chances of winning the Vietnam War

NBC's unprecedented on-air announcement, Star Trek will return

The BBC broadcasts the news for the first time in color on television

CBS TV suspends Radio Free Europe free advertising because RFE doesn't make it clear it is sponsored by the CIA

The Ed Sullivan Show

Bee Gees make their US TV debut on "The Ed Sullivan Show" performing "To Love Somebody" and "Words"

WVER TV channel 28 in Rutland, VT (PBS) begins broadcasting

Mar 18 WVTA TV channel 41 in Windsor, VT (PBS) begins broadcasting

KLVX TV channel 10 in Las Vegas, NV (PBS) begins broadcasting

KEMO (now KOFY) TV channel 20 in San Francisco, California (IND) 1st broadcast

2001 A Space Odyssey

"2001 A Space Odyssey" directed by Stanley Kubrick and starring Keir Dullea and Gary Lockwood, premieres at the Uptown Theater in Washington, D.C.

Planet of the Apes

Science fiction film "Planet of the Apes", starring Charlton Heston and Roddy McDowell, opens nationally in the United States

40th Academy Awards postponed to Apr 10th due to death of Martin Luther King

Apr 8 WKPI TV channel 22 in Pikeville, Kentucky (PBS) begins broadcasting

40th Academy Awards: "In the Heat of the Night", Rod Steiger & Katherine Hepburn win

George M!

Musical "George M!", based on the life of Broadway star George M. Cohan, opens at Palace Theater NYC for 435 performances

WHED TV channel 15 in Hanover, NH (PBS) begins broadcasting

ABC Masters Bowling Tournament won by Pete Tountas

Israeli television begins transmitting

MacArthur Park

Irish actor Richard Harris releases single "MacArthur Park"; it becomes a million-seller topping the charts in Canada and Australia, and peaking at #2 in US and #4 in UK

WSKG TV channel 46 (PBS) in Binghamton, NY, begins broadcasting

Wonderwall

"Wonderwall" with music by George Harrison, premieres at Cannes Film Festival

TV Show Appearance

Paul McCartney & John Lennon appear on "The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson", to promote Apple Records, Joe Garagiola is substitute host

20th Emmy Awards: "Get Smart", "Mission Impossible" & Barbara Bain win

Paul McCartney and girlfriend Jane Asher attend an Andy Williams concert

May 21 WEKW TV channel 52 in Keene, NH (PBS) begins broadcasting

Film & TV History

Movie star James Stewart retires from the US Air Force after 27 years of service

WBLG (now WTVQ) TV channel 62 in Lexington, KY (ABC) 1st broadcast

WKHA TV channel 35 in Hazard, KY (PBS) begins broadcasting

Television Finale

"Danny Thomas Hour" last airs on NBC-TV

Jun 10 KCFW TV channel 9 in Kalispell, MT (ABC/NBC) begins broadcasting

Jun 10 WHTV (now WTZH) TV channel 24 in Meridian, MS (NBC/CBS) 1st broadcast

Film Premiere

U.S. premiere of horror film "Rosemary's Baby", based on the bestselling novel of the same name by Ira Levin

KQEC TV channel 32 in San Francisco, California (PBS) begins broadcasting

18th Berlin International Film Festival: "Who Saw Him Die?" wins the Golden Bear

Music Concert

American jazz musician Louis Armstrong leads his All-Star band in a performance at the BBC television studio in London, England; the thirteen song set is broadcast in September

BBC-TV broadcasts "Farewell", folk-rock band The Seekers final performance, draws 10 million viewers

WSWO TV channel 26 in Springfield, OH (ABC) begins broadcasting

"One Life to Live", American soap opera, premieres on TV

The Beatles' animated film "Yellow Submarine" premieres in London

Jane Asher breaks her engagement with Beatle bassist, singer, and songwriter Paul McCartney, live on BBC-TV's "Dee Time" programme

Judy Garland's Last Concert

Judy Garland headlines concert also featuring Count Basie and Jackie Wilson at JFK Stadium, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania; her last US concert

WXIX TV channel 19 in Cincinnati-Newport, OH (IND) begins broadcasting

WXTV TV channel 41 in New York-Paterson, NY (UNI) begins broadcasting

WMCV (now WZTV) TV channel 17 in Nashville, TN (IND) 1st broadcast

29th Venice Film Festival: "Artists Under the Big Top: Perplexed" directed by Alexander Kluge wins Golden Lion

Telethon

Jerry Lewis' 3rd Muscular Dystrophy telethon

WGIQ TV channel 43 in Louisville, AL (PBS) begins broadcasting

Sep 9 WVPT TV channel 51 in Staunton, VA (PBS) begins broadcasting

Barbra Streisand: A Happening in Central Park

"Barbra Streisand: A Happening in Central Park" premieres on CBS TV

Sep 15 WUAB TV channel 43 in Lorain-Cleveland, Ohio (IND) begins broadcasting

Sep 15 WXON TV channel 20 in Detroit, MI (IND) begins broadcasting

KLNI (now KADN) TV channel 15 in Lafayette, LA (IND) begins

"Funny Girl" biopic film based on life of Fanny Brice premieres, directed by William Wyler, starring Barbra Streisand and Omar Sharif

Police drama "Adam-12" debuts on NBC in the US

KMTC (now KDEB) TV channel 27 in Springfield, MO (IND) 1st broadcast

WKAS TV channel 25 in Ashland, KY (PBS) begins broadcasting

Sep 23 WKGB TV channel 53 in Bowling Green, KY (PBS) begins broadcasting

Sep 23 WKLE TV channel 46 in Lexington, KY (PBS) begins broadcasting

Sep 23 WKMA TV channel 35 in Madisonville, KY (PBS) begins broadcasting

Sep 23 WKMR TV channel 38 in Morehead, KY (PBS) begins broadcasting

Sep 23 WKON TV channel 52 in Owenton, KY (PBS) begins broadcasting

Sep 23 WKSO TV channel 29 in Somerset, KY (PBS) begins broadcasting

Sep 23 WKZT TV channel 23 in Elizabethtown, KY (PBS) begins broadcasting

60 Minutes

"60 Minutes" premieres on CBS-TV

Sep 24 "That's Life" premieres - A Broadway musical type TV show

"Oliver!" directed by Carol Reed and starring Mark Lester and Ron Moody premieres in London (Best Picture 1969)

Sep 26 1st broadcast of "Hawaii Five-O" on CBS-TV

Music History

"Noël Coward's Sweet Potato" opens at Barrymore NYC for 17 performances

Sep 28 John Kander and Fred Ebb's musical "The Happy Time", starring Robert Goulet, closes at Broadway Theater, NYC, after 286 performances

Love Child

The Supremes release single "Love Child"

Night of the Living Dead

Cult zombie film "Night of the Living Dead" directed by George A. Romero, starring Duane Jones and Judith O'Dea premieres in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

KPLM (now KESQ) TV channel 42 in Palm Springs, CA (ABC) begins

The Beatles promotional films (music videos) for "Hey Jude" and "Revolution" first broadcast in the US on "The Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour"

WKMU TV channel 21 in Murray, KY (PBS) begins broadcasting

"Noël Coward's Sweet Potato" closes at Barrymore Theater, NYC, after 17 performances

American Bob Seagren, Claus Schiprowski of West Germany and East German Wolfgang Nordwig all record 5.40m in the final of the pole vault at the Mexico City Olympics; Seagren awarded gold on countback

Bullitt

"Bullitt" directed by Peter Yates and starring Steve McQueen and Jacqueline Bisset is 1st released

KMIR TV channel 36 in Palm Springs, CA (NBC) begins broadcasting

Musical revue "Noël Coward's Sweet Potato" opens at Booth Theater, NYC; runs for 36 performances

WRDU (now WPTF) TV channel 28 in Raleigh-Durham, NC (NBC) 1st broadcast

Nov 4 WTOG TV channel 44 in St Petersburg-Tampa, FL (IND) 1st broadcast

Film Premiere

Psychedelic feature film "Head" starring the Monkees, and co-written by Jack Nicholson, a premieres in New York City

Al Pacino stars in "Deadly Circle of Violence", an episode of the ABC television series NYPD

Nov 12 KSEL (now KAMC) TV channel 28 in Lubbock, TX (ABC) begins broadcasting

U.S. premiere of film version of Morris L. West's best seller "The Shoes of the Fisherman"

"Heidi Game", NBC cuts to show "Heidi" and misses Raider's rally to beat Jets, 43-32

Nov 17 Beatle George Harrison makes cameo appearance on "The Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour"

Nov 17 KHNE TV channel 29 in Hastings, NB (PBS) begins broadcasting

The Supremes & The Temptations release "I'm Gonna Make You Love Me"

1st interracial TV kiss (Star Trek - Captain Kirk and Uhura)

Musical revue "Noël Coward's Sweet Potato" closes at Booth Theatre, NYC, after 44 performances

15th National Film Awards (India): "Hatey Bazarey" wins the Golden Lotus

Elvis' Comeback Special

Elvis Presley's Comeback Special airs on NBC, his 1st live performance in seven years, re-launching his singing career

WKID (WSCV) TV channel 51 in Fort Lauderdale, Florida (IND) 1st broadcast

KRNE TV channel 12 in Merriman, NB (PBS) begins broadcasting

'Ulster stands at the Crossroads'

Terence O'Neill, Northern Ireland Prime Minister, makes a television appeal for moderate opinion in what became known as the 'Ulster stands at the Crossroads' speech

KECC (now KECY) TV channel 9 in El Centro, CA (CBS) 1st broadcast

Missing Stones Film

Rolling Stones film TV show "Rock and Roll Circus"- guest performers include The Who, Jethro Tull, Taj Mahal, Marianne Faithfull, and John Lennon and Yoko Ono; the program never airs aired

KFIZ TV channel 34 in Fond du Lac, Wisconsin begins broadcasting

Chitty Chitty Bang Bang

Musical-fantasy film "Chitty Chitty Bang Bang", co-written by Roald Dahl and director Ken Hughes, starring Dick Van Dyke and Sally Ann Howes, with songs by Sherman and Sherman, premieres at the Odeon Leicester Square theater, London

Musical-fantasy film "Chitty Chitty Bang Bang", co-written by Roald Dahl and director Ken Hughes, starring Dick Van Dyke and Sally Ann Howes, with songs by Sherman and Sherman, premieres in NYC

WCWB (now WMGT) TV channel 41 in Macon, GA (NBC) begins broadcasting

WATU (now WAGT) TV channel 26 in Augusta, GA (CBS) begins broadcasting

KVOF (KUDO, now KWBB) TV channel 38 in San Francisco, California (IND) 1st broadcast
